quiz.text: What do you mean by 'Demographic Dividend'?
options: A rise in the rate of economic growth due to a higher share of working age people in a population
A rise in the rate of literacy due to development of educational institutions in different parts of the country
A rise in the standard of living of the people due to the growth of alternative livelihood practices
A rise in the gross employment ratio of a country due to government policies
None of the above

quiz.text: To obtain full benefits of demographic dividend, what should India do?
options: Promoting skill development
Introducing more social security schemes
Reducing infant mortality rate
Privatization of higher education
None of the above

quiz.text:
The demographic dividend occurs due to 

  1. falling birth rate and consequent shift in the age structure. 
  2. falling birth rate and changes in the age structure towards the adult working ages. 
  3. falling death rate.
options: Only 2
Only 1
Only 3
Only 2 and 3
Only 1 and 3

quiz.text: As per the 2011 Census, which of the following is the least populated state in India?
options: Mizoram
Sikkim
Tripura
Uttarakhand
Tripura

quiz.text: What percentage of the Population resides in rural areas as per Census 2011?
options: 72.48 %
68.84%
58.84%
65.76%
82.12%

quiz.text: As per the Census 2011, the sex ratio in India stands at?
options: 947
943
935
915
920

quiz.text: The number of children (aged under 14) and old people (aged 60 or 65 and over) in a population as a ratio of the number of adults (aged 15-59/64) is known as
options: Labour Force
Working Population Ratio
Dependency Ratio
Unemployed population
None of the above.

quiz.text: As per Census 2011, the literacy rate of India is:
options: 74.04%
69.04%
76.04%
67.04%
80.04%

quiz.text: The National Population Policy came into effect in which of the following years?
options: 2000
2005
2010
2015
2002

quiz.text: The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment has adopted a National Policy on Older Persons in which year?
options: 1998
1992
1993
1999
2001

quiz.text: Which of the following cannot be drawn from the population pyramid of the country?
options: Dependency Ratio
Population Growth Rate
Gender distribution within Population
Total Population Size
None of the above

quiz.text: Who among the following is called as the ‘Father of Demographic Studies’?
options: Karl Marx
Neil Adger
Tim Cresswell
Aryabhatt
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following earliest treaty used the term 'census' for the first time in India?
options: Akbarnama
Arthashastra
Rajatrangini
Ain-e-Akbari
None of the above

quiz.text: When was first census held in India?
options: 1872
1875
1881
1891
1901

quiz.text: Total fertility Rate refers to
options: The number of children a woman has given birth to since marriage
Total number of children born minus total number of children that died in a given year
Birth rate minus Death rate
The number of live births by a woman during the entire reproductive period
None of the above

quiz.text: What does the infant mortality rate refer to?
options: The ratio of the number of children who die before their fifth birthday out of every 1000 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their first birthday out of every 1000 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their fifth birthday out of every 100 live births.
The ratio of the number of children who die before their first birthday out of every 100 live births.
None of the above

quiz.text: The maternal mortality ratio is expressed in terms of
options: 1000 live births
100 live births
10000 live births
100000 live births
10 live births

quiz.text: Which year is known as the year of demographic divide?
options: 1901
1921
1931
1951
1981

quiz.text: Which period is referred to as the period of population explosion?
options: 1901- 1921
1921- 1951
1951- 1981
1981- 2011
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statement (s) related to the reasons for the low sex ratio:
  1. Son Preference
  2. Sex-selective female abortions
  3. Change in sex ratio at birth as over the period of time
options: Only 1
Only 1 and 2
Only 2 and 3
Only 1 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: What is not included in the advantages of demographic dividend?
options: Increased labour force
Increased fiscal space
Decrease in women's workforce
Increase in savings rate
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is the most literate district in India as per Census 2011?
options: Kottayam
Serchhip
Champhai
Ernakulam
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following cannot be considered as measures to be taken so that demographic dividend would benefit?
options: Increase spending on health
Increase spending on education
Decreased investments in Research and Development
Increased efforts for skill development
Increased investments in Research and Development

quiz.text: Which of the following is an important determinant of population change?
options: Migration
Net Attendance Ratio
Human Development Report
Life Expectancy
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following among is among the pull factors of migration?
options: Security of life
Unemployment
Poor living condition
Unpleasant climate
All of the above
